line_1: Thus always teazing others, always teazed,
line_2: His only pleasure is — to be displeas'd.

line_1: Or you for ever will be teaz'd,
line_2: You should be proud, and seem displeas'd,

line_1: And by his friend behind was teaz'd
line_2: Each as he came th' infection seiz'd,

line_1: Fitful I gaze, with adverse humours teased,
line_2: Half sad, half proud, half angry, and half pleased.

line_1: Or if he teaz'd, with nought he teaz'd,
line_2: Pleas'd with himself, with all well-pleas'd,

line_1: Not soon provoked, however stung and teaz'd,
line_2: And if perhaps made angry, soon appeas'd,

line_1: By cares nor crosses was I teaz'd,
line_2: Nor spleen, nor passion, on me seiz'd:

line_1: But she who had the Charmer teaz'd;
line_2: While all were with her Musick pleas'd,
